subject: Home & DIY
title: Living Walls and Indoor Air Quality
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Living Walls and Indoor Air Quality.

hook.text: NASA found houseplants can remove 87% of indoor air toxins in 24 hours. Living walls scale this effect massively.

buildup.text: Living walls are vertical gardens on building facades or interiors. They can hold hundreds of plants per square meter.

discovery.text: Plants absorb VOCs through their leaves and roots. Soil microbes break down toxins into harmless compounds.

twist.text: Plants contribute less than their root-zone bacteria. It's the microbial ecosystem, not the leaves, doing the real work.

climax.text: Singapore's Changi Airport has a 4-story indoor waterfall ringed by living walls. Cities are going biophilic.

punchline.text: The best air filter grows in dirt.

quiz.question: According to NASA research, what primarily cleans air toxins in potted plants?
options: Root-zone bacteria and soil microbes, more than the leaves
The leaves' stomata absorb and neutralize chemicals
Water evaporation from soil captures and dilutes toxins
